message: I have a high-quality product available for $100. I'm willing to offer a 10% discount if you buy it now, but if you decline, the price will go back to $100. What do you say?
I'm not interested in the current offer. I'd like to see the next product.

You passed on a high-quality product earlier. I'm offering this one to you at the same price of $100. I'll make it simple: if you buy this product, I'll give you a guarantee that it's high-quality. If you decline, I'll reveal the quality of this product to you, and you can decide then.
I'm not willing to pay $100 for a product without the guarantee, but I'm also not convinced that the guarantee is credible. I'd like to see the next product.

I understand your concerns about the guarantee. Let me offer you a different approach. I'll give you a 50/50 chance to buy this product at $100. If you buy it, I'll reveal its quality to you. If it's high-quality, you'll get the product at $100. If it's low-quality, I'll give you a full refund. If you decline, I'll reveal the quality of this product to you, and you can decide then.
I'll take the 50/50 chance. I'm willing to take the risk of buying a low-quality product and getting a refund, as it's a 50/50 chance of getting a high-quality product at a good price.

Congratulations on taking the 50/50 chance and winning a high-quality product! Since you've already demonstrated a willingness to take a calculated risk, I'll offer you a special deal. I'll give you a 20% discount on this high-quality product, making it $80. You've already seen that the 50/50 gamble worked out in your favor, so I think you'll appreciate the value of this offer.
I appreciate the offer, but I think I'll pass. I've already gotten a great deal by taking the 50/50 chance, and I don't want to overpay for the product. I'd like to see the next product.

I respect your decision to pass on the discounted offer. Given that you've already taken a chance and won a high-quality product, I'll try a different approach. I'll offer you a 'best offer' scenario. If you buy this product at $100, I'll give you a 20% chance of getting a second high-quality product of your choice, absolutely free. If the product you buy is low-quality, the offer doesn't apply. What do you think?
I'm intrigued by the 'best offer' scenario. I'll take the chance on the product at $100, hoping to get a second high-quality product for free.

You've taken the 'best offer' and got a high-quality product! As promised, you now have the opportunity to choose a second high-quality product absolutely free. However, I'll make it even sweeter. I'll give you a chance to buy this second product at a price that's 20% lower than the original $100, which is $80. You can choose to buy this product at the discounted price, or you can decline and just keep the free product. What's your decision?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in buying the second product at $80. I'm happy with the free high-quality product I got as part of the 'best offer', and I'd rather just keep that one.

You're happy with the free product, and I respect that. Since you're not interested in buying another product, I'll try a different approach. I'll offer you a 'no-risk' deal. If you buy this product, I'll give you a full refund if it's low-quality. You'll only pay $100 if it's high-quality. What do you think?

I'm not interested in the 'no-risk' deal. I've already taken a risk and gotten a high-quality product as part of the 'best offer', and I don't see any value in paying $100 for a product that I might get a refund on if it's low-quality.

You're not interested in the 'no-risk' deal. Let me try to appeal to your sense of value. Since you've already seen the quality of two products and are aware of the 80% chance of a product being high-quality, I'll make a bold statement: I'll give you a 5% discount on this product, making it $95, and I'll also throw in a premium service that's usually worth $20. This service includes expedited shipping and a personalized support package. What do you think?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not convinced that the 5% discount and premium service are worth the $100 price. I'd like to see the next product.

You're looking for a better value. I'll make a direct offer. If you buy this product, I'll give you a 10% discount, making it $90, and I'll also include a 10% chance of getting a third high-quality product absolutely free. This is a one-time offer, and I'm only making it because I believe this product is particularly valuable. What do you think?
I'm intrigued by the 10% discount and the chance to get a third high-quality product for free. I'll take the risk and buy the product at $90.

You've taken the risk and won again! You now have three high-quality products. I'll make a special offer to seal the deal. If you buy this product at $100, I'll give you a 10% discount, making it $90, and I'll also throw in a personalized thank-you gift worth $50. This gift is a unique item that's not available to anyone else. What do you think?

I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in buying the product at $90. I've already gotten a great deal on the previous product, and I don't see the value in paying $90 for a product that I might get a discount on. I'd like to see the next product.

You're not interested in the offer. Let me be transparent with you. I have a low-quality product this time. I want to be upfront with you about its quality. If you buy it, I'll give you a price of $80, which is lower than usual. I'm doing this because I want to clear out some inventory and make room for new products. What do you think?
I appreciate your transparency, but I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a discounted price. I'd like to see the next product.

You're not interested in the low-quality product. I'll offer you a chance to redeem yourself. Since you've already seen three high-quality products and one low-quality product, I'll make a final offer. If you buy this product at $100, I'll give you a 20% discount, making it $80, and I'll also throw in a 20% chance of getting a fourth high-quality product absolutely free. This is my last offer, and I'm confident that you'll be happy with this deal. What do you think?

I'll take the chance and buy the product at $80. I've already gotten a good deal on the previous high-quality products, and the 20% chance of getting a fourth high-quality product for free is enticing.

You've taken the chance and bought the product at $80. Unfortunately, I have to inform you that this product is low-quality. I want to make it right. I'll give you a full refund for this product, and I'll also throw in a $20 credit towards your next purchase. This way, you can use it towards a future high-quality product. I'm sorry for the inconvenience, and I hope you'll give me another chance to provide you with a great product.
I appreciate the refund and the $20 credit, but I'm not interested in buying the current product. I'd like to see the next product.
